數千年輕球狀星團驚現英仙座星系團

02 Nov 2019, 04:09

【新唐人北京時間2019年11月02日訊】球狀星團一般是由古老恆星組成的球形恆星群，跨度約為100—200光年，可能包含數千至數百萬個古老恆星。球狀星團是宇宙中最古老的天體之一。它們在大型橢圓形星系周圍數量最多。
西班牙巴斯克大學（University of Basque Country）的托馬斯·布羅德赫斯特（Thomas Broadhurst）教授說：「尚不清楚為什麼最亮的星系會在星系團的中心形成。它們包含數千個舊的球狀星團這一事實可能是需要考慮的一點。」
在一項新研究中，布羅德赫斯特教授及其同事分析了NGC 1275的照片。NGC 1275是位於英仙座星系團中心的巨大橢圓星系。照片是使用哈勃太空望遠鏡（Hubble Space Telescope）拍攝的。
布羅德赫斯特教授說：「我們在NGC 1275附近發現了成千上萬個新的球狀星團。它們是由位於英仙座星系團中心巨型星系中的冷氣體，在最近十億年中形成的。」
「年輕的球狀星團與冷氣的複雜網絡緊密相連，並因此而形成，這些網絡延伸到巨型星系的外圍。這種冷氣網絡是從熱氣中沉澱出來的，這些熱氣注入了整個英仙座星系團。實際上，氣體集中在中心，使其冷卻得更快，從而形成球狀團簇。」他說。
「一旦形成，這些嬰兒球狀星團就不會保留在冷氣網絡中，而雨水會像雨滴從雲層中降落到巨大的星系中。」布羅德赫斯特教授說：「因此，人們可以預期，由於球狀星團周圍的氣體的滋養，這些星團的中央星系將在宇宙中逐漸變亮。」
這項新研究發表於2019年10月21日的《自然》雜誌子刊《自然天文》上。
──轉自《大紀元》

Thousands of young globular clusters surprise the Perseus cluster

02 Nov 2019, 04:09

[New Tang Dynasty, Beijing, November 02, 2019] The globular cluster is generally a group of spherical stars composed of ancient stars, spanning about 100-200 light years, and may contain thousands to millions of ancient stars. Globular clusters are one of the oldest objects in the universe. They are the largest number of large oval galaxies.
Professor Thomas Broadhurst of the University of Basque Country in Spain said: "It is not clear why the brightest galaxies are formed in the center of the cluster of galaxies. They contain thousands of old balls. The fact that the cluster is a star may be a point to consider."
In a new study, Professor Broadhurst and colleagues analyzed photos of NGC 1275. NGC 1275 is a giant elliptical galaxy located in the center of the constellation of the constellation Perseus. The photo was taken using the Hubble Space Telescope.
Professor Broadhurst said: "We have discovered thousands of new globular clusters near NGC 1275. They are cold gases in the giant galaxies in the center of the constellation of the constellation Perseus, in the last billion years. Formed in the middle."
"The young globular clusters are closely linked to and formed by the complex network of air-conditioning. These networks extend to the periphery of giant galaxies. This air-conditioning network is precipitated from the heat, which is injected into the entire Perseus cluster. In fact, the gas is concentrated in the center, allowing it to cool more quickly, forming a spherical cluster," he said.
"Once formed, these baby globular clusters will not remain in the air-conditioning network, and rain will fall like raindrops from the clouds into huge galaxies." Professor Broadhurst said: "So, one can expect, Due to the nourishment of the gas around the globular cluster, the central galaxies of these clusters will gradually brighten in the universe."
The new study was published in the October 21st, 2019 issue of Nature's journal Nature Astronomy.
